author: Dave Michaels
title: How to Cover Up Alleged Fraud? Suppress Online Comments from Disgruntled Investors, SEC Says
text:
Executives in Texas involved in an alleged oil and gas fraud raised money the old-fashioned way: by cold-calling investors. To keep the cash coming in, they turned to a novel tool: suppressing negative comments on the internet from angry investors.
The managers of AmeraTex Energy Inc. paid service providers about $55,000 to make it harder to find comments from disgruntled investors when using search engines, the Securities and Exchange Commission alleged in a lawsuit filed this week in federal court in North Texas. The SEC...
